summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on September 22, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript, a signed warnings form, an earlier FBI 302 interview of the manager, and a memorandum written by the manager regarding Epstein.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Unit Manager
events.description: Special Agent and Senior Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of BOP Unit Manager MI at the MCC New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Housed at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, federal inmate register number 76318-054, was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York during July and August 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: This document is part of the official DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigation into the death of federal inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The OIG interviewed BOP Unit Manager MI on September 22, 2021; MI was the unit manager when Epstein was housed at MCC New York in July/August 2019.
Attachments to the memorandum include the 2021 interview transcript, an FBI 302 interview of MI from August 12, 2019, and a memorandum written by MI about Epstein dated August 10, 2019.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is for internal agency distribution only.
